name: ethyl 5-hydroxy-2-methyl-3-oxo-6-(2,2,3-trimethylcyclopent-3-en-1-yl)hexanoate
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1951
Reason: 5-hydroxy-2-methyl-3-oxo-6-(2,2,3-trimethylcyclopent-3-en-1-yl)hexanoate has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components. The basic unit for our comparison will be hexanoic acid, which has a melting point of -10.0°C (according to the CRC Handbook of Chemistry and Physics, 49th Edition, 1968-1969). The structural modifications we need to consider are the presence of two additional phenyl rings, a methoxy group, a hydroxyl group, and a trimethylcyclopent-3-en-1-yl group. Each additional phenyl group can be estimated to add approximately 100°C to the melting point due to increased pi-pi interactions, rigidity, and molecular weight. The methoxy group can raise the melting point by about +5 °C due to additional molecular weight and the capacity for hydrogen bonding. The hydroxyl group can also contribute to the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and the capacity for hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +5 °C. The trimethylcyclopent-3-en-1-yl group can also contribute to the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and the capacity for hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +5 °C.
